How did other people discover KSP?

I just wish people showing off the game would be less terrible in it. They make "game journalists" look bad. I mean neither really even showed how a "proper" rocket would fly (and get to orbit) - okay, so they were just giving it a quick spin "first impressions" but all they really showed is that they had no clue how rockets work in real life. An idea for everyone who is worried about how the game is going to change, save your old versions.

How did other people discover KSP?

through a German Let's Player since the Version 13.3, i always wanted a game like this!

I actually found it through GiantBomb as well, but it was before christmas. One of the guys writing their top 10's for 2011 wrote about KSP. He was just a guest writer, none of the guys who work there. He mentioned it was the game he probably played the most that year. I took a look, 5 minutes later I bought it. This is exactly the kinda game I love. A physics sandbox for me to mess around and screw up stuff in spectacular fashion.

This game is amazing

Is it? I mean dont get me wrong I hope ksp becomes popular. But what happens when something is too popular?

Usually, they start acting strangely, buy things they don't actually want, spend less time with old friends, only go out with other too-popular ones... oh, you meant for game developers? The extra attention and money ensures they are rewarded for their good work, and increases their confidence for whatever they do next.

I just wish people showing off the game would be less terrible in it. They make "game journalists" look bad. I mean neither really even showed how a "proper" rocket would fly (and get to orbit) - okay, so they were just giving it a quick spin "first impressions" but all they really showed is that they had no clue how rockets work in real life. At all.

At least it gives viewers a realistic impression of how their first few flights will go, but I agree they also need to show what can be achieved once a player has developed his skills, because it's not all crashes and burns!
I think the best thing would be how they mention the good players, which of course leads to searching more youtube or related links. Afterwards, hopefully that gets them the oh cool!
